content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Maryam Abbasi from Iran. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in Duisburg. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Maryam Abbasi from Iran

content: Hello Maryam, nice to meet you. I'm glad you like the apartment. As a landlord, I'm looking to get the best possible price for my property. I believe the market rate for a 50 square meter one-bedroom apartment in this location is around 800-900 Euro per month. However, I'm willing to negotiate and consider offers that are close to this range. What's your offer?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I am a student, so I am not able to pay such a high price. I can offer 500 Euro per month.
name: Maryam Abbasi from Iran

content:
I understand that you're a student and have limited budget. However, the price I quoted you is already below market rate, and I can't afford to go any lower than that. The apartment is a newly built, unfurnished property in a prime location, and I have to consider my own expenses and profit margins.

I'm willing to negotiate and meet you halfway, but the lowest I can go is 600 Euro per month. This is an excellent price for a property of this quality and location, and I'm sure you'll find it to be a great value.

So, what do you say? Are you willing to accept the price of 600 Euro per month?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: 600 Euro per month is still too high for me. I can offer 525 Euro per month.
name: Maryam Abbasi from Iran

content:
I understand that 600 Euro per month is still out of your budget, and I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. However, I'm afraid that 525 Euro per month is too low for me to consider.

As a landlord, I have expenses and costs associated with maintaining the property, and I need to ensure that the rent I receive covers those costs. I've already lowered the price significantly from the market rate, and I can't afford to go any lower than 600 Euro per month.

I'm willing to compromise and meet you halfway again, but the lowest I can go is 550 Euro per month. This is an excellent price for a property of this quality and location, and I'm sure you'll find it to be a great value.

So, what do you say? Are you willing to accept the price of 550 Euro per month?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: 550 Euro per month is still too high for me. I can offer 525 Euro per month.
name: Maryam Abbasi from Iran

content:
I understand that 550 Euro per month is still out of your budget, and I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. However, I'm afraid that 525 Euro per month is too low for me to consider.

As a landlord, I have expenses and costs associated with maintaining the property, and I need to ensure that the rent I receive covers those costs. I've already lowered the price significantly from the market rate, and I can't afford to go any lower than 550 Euro per month.

I understand that this may not be the answer you were hoping for, but I hope you can understand my position. I'm willing to work with you to find a solution that works for both of us, but I can't compromise on the rent price any further.

If you're still interested in renting the apartment, I'm happy to discuss the terms of the lease and answer any questions you may have. However, if the rent price is still too high for you, I understand and we can part ways amicably.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I understand your situation. Since 550 Euro per month is the lowest rent price you can offer, I accept the price of 550 Euro per month.
name: Maryam Abbasi from Iran

content:
Great, I'm glad we could come to an agreement! I'll draw up the lease agreement and send it to you for review. Please let me know if you have any questions or concerns.

In the meantime, I'll also prepare the apartment for your move-in. I'll make sure that it's clean and ready for you to move in on the agreed date.

I'm looking forward to having you as a tenant and I'm confident that you'll enjoy living in this apartment. Let me know if there's anything else I can do to help you.

TERMINATE
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany
